attributes.title: Kittling Ridge Estate Wines and Spirits

attributes.description: Where the fine students of Georgian College chug back bottles of anything they can get their hands on.
attributes.title: Consumer

attributes.description:
One of seven Kittling Ridge Wine Boutiques, sold right on site where the wine is made.

Once the wine is produced and ready for consumption it is shipped to their boutiques. This wine can also be found in liquor stores.

attributes.title: Retail Store

attributes.description: The Kittling Ridge Estate Wines and Spirits is located in Grimsby, Ontario and recieved its name from both the beautiful Niagara escarpment and the birds that fly overhead and engage in a ritual called kittling. This is the only %100 Canadian owned distillery in Ontario, and was founded by John K. Hall. This estate does all their own production and has everything from the fruit processing area and fermentation cellars, to the copper pot and column still towers and the oak barrel ageing cellars. The escarpment allows for protection for the vineyards so that the grapes used for the wine can grow to a great taste. The estate grows and produces and distributes their products from this estate. There was limited information on where the rye, barley and corn came from so the wine was only way to show a true supply chain.
attributes.title: Kittling Ridge Estate
